Award.AwardTitle: Scientific Computing Research Environments for the Mathematical Sciences (SCREMS)
Award.AbstractNarration: The Department of Statistics at the University of Michigan will purchase high-end computing<br/>equipment which will be dedicated to the support of research in statistical sciences. The equipment<br/>will be dedicated to the support of research in the following projects: (1) Optimizing interventions<br/>in the behavioral sciences; (2) Statistical methodology for networks; (3)High dimensional<br/>and functional data analysis with applications to bioinformatics and chemoinformatics; (4) Modeling<br/>spatio-temporal network properties of the brain and (5) Stochastic dynamical systems and<br/>their applications. Further, the proposed equipment will greatly enhance the overall research and<br/>education infrastructure of the Department of Statistics.<br/>The research to be supported by the planned equipment involves statistical methodology<br/>that covers a wide variety of scientific disciplines, including medical and life sciences, health care,<br/>information sciences and technology, brain science and infectious diseases. Scientific discoveries<br/>would greatly benefit society and the economy.

Institution.Name: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
